intro: Emilia sonchifolia var. sonchifolia, commonly known as common emilia, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features bright yellow flowers with a distinctive central disk surrounded by ray florets, typical of the Asteraceae family. The plant has alternate, heart-shaped leaves that are hairy and covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in disturbed areas and along roadsides. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
